page.title: 10LAND AND WILD LIFE DUNSFORD.
page.content: The sloping land still has quite small fields.A few hedges have been taken out to help machine farming but the majority remain.The lanes skirt the fields following the routes of old cart tracks.Many hedges are hundreds of years old with a wide vatiety of plant and animal life.Each of our km. squares is mainly farmland but each contains some woodland.Some were planted as game cover,some as windbreaks but many came naturally in awkward corners or on steep slopes.It is unusual to drive along the lanes without seeing a pheasant,a rabbit,a squirrel or a mouse.You may even see a hare,fox,weasel,badger or deer.Many different species of birds can be seen and heard.
